column4: hi, i'm considering using either ubuntu or ubuntu server. I have an old desktop I want to use ubuntu on, but I will mainly be using it as a file server; however, I'd also like to be able to do some minimal GUI stuff on it, like firefox
fluxbox is an great lightweight window manager. as is windowmaker
but ubuntu, or ubuntu server?
sounds good then... the server edition has less stuff in it?
I've not used ubuntu-server for several releases. but that is the jist
sounds good for my nefarious purposes
maybe just screen and links2 will suit you then?
screen and links2? what is that?
screen is a terminal app that lets you have multiple shells open simultaneously.  links2 is an ncurses based browser with graphic support
ah, I know links, or lynx, I've sen one of them before. I'd prefer firefox, I'd say.
hehe, just depends on how minimal you want to go :)
sure, but if I have to learn new stuff, it will take me more effort than I'd care to.
I will of course install ssh-server and tell it what to do from my laptop ASAP anyway.
effort + learning = hacking = good
I agree, for most purposes
is it problematic to set up network services on ubuntu desktop?
I agree :)
I'll have to look up derogative to be sure, but sounds right
no. ifconfig and man are your friends
great, thanks... I'm thinking about SSH and possibly some network file share to have at home
is the alternate install CD faster?
less than an hour either way
I'll try alternate just for the hacking of it then
I like your style
